channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota Sen. Tina Smith weighs in on Minneapolis shooting death by ICE agent
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Minnesota Sen. Tina Smith about the Minneapolis shooting in which an ICE agent killed a 37-year-old woman.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Minnesota Sen. Tina Smith about the Minneapolis shooting in which an ICE agent killed a 37-year-old woman.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker once bound for Venezuela
item.description: After a two-week chase, U.S. forces seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic. The tanker was originally bound for Venezuela but had changed course to avoid the U.S. ships.
item.content:encoded: After a two-week chase, U.S. forces seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic. The tanker was originally bound for Venezuela but had changed course to avoid the U.S. ships.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Old and new faces reach the Billboard Hot 100 charts
item.description: After a rush of holiday-themed music, a sweep of new pop songs move up the chart.
item.content:encoded: After a rush of holiday-themed music, a sweep of new pop songs move up the chart.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: Denmark is telling President Trump to stop threatening to seize Greenland
item.description: Politicians in Denmark are dealing with widespread fears over U.S. officials' statements about taking over the Danish territory of Greenland. President Trump said it's crucial for security interests.
item.content:encoded: Politicians in Denmark are dealing with widespread fears over U.S. officials' statements about taking over the Danish territory of Greenland. President Trump said it's crucial for security interests.
item.dc:creator: Adrienne Murray

item.title: Venezuela's political opposition is unclear about what to do next
item.description: President Trump sidelined Venezuela's opposition in his raid of the country and seizure of the president. Where are those leaders now?
item.content:encoded: President Trump sidelined Venezuela's opposition in his raid of the country and seizure of the president. Where are those leaders now?
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: At CES, the world's biggest tech companies hope to make a splash
item.description: At this year's CES convention in Las Vegas, the world's biggest consumer technology companies are hoping to make a splash, showcasing new chips, robots and AI-enabled devices.
item.content:encoded: At this year's CES convention in Las Vegas, the world's biggest consumer technology companies are hoping to make a splash, showcasing new chips, robots and AI-enabled devices.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: The role Secretary Marco Rubio is playing in Venezuela's future
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to play a central role in Venezuela now that Nicolas Maduro has been ousted. John Hudson, national security reporter for The Washington Post, weighs in.
item.content:encoded: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to play a central role in Venezuela now that Nicolas Maduro has been ousted. John Hudson, national security reporter for The Washington Post, weighs in.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Aldrich Ames, CIA officer who spied for Soviet Union, has died at 84
item.description: One of the most notorious spies in U.S. history, Aldrich Ames, died on Tuesday at the age of 84. As a CIA officer, Ames sold highly classified secrets to the Soviet Union starting in the mid 1980s.
item.content:encoded: One of the most notorious spies in U.S. history, Aldrich Ames, died on Tuesday at the age of 84. As a CIA officer, Ames sold highly classified secrets to the Soviet Union starting in the mid 1980s.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Women's para ice hockey edges closer to its own Paralympic stage
item.description: When the Paralympics begin in Italy, one sport that won't be in the competition is women's para ice hockey. But after a successful World Championships, players hope it could be added in the future.
item.content:encoded: When the Paralympics begin in Italy, one sport that won't be in the competition is women's para ice hockey. But after a successful World Championships, players hope it could be added in the future.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chen-Newton

item.title: An immigration and enforcement officer shoots and kills a woman in Minneapolis
item.description: An officer with Immigration and Customs Enforcement shot and killed a woman during the Trump administrations' latest immigration crackdown in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: An officer with Immigration and Customs Enforcement shot and killed a woman during the Trump administrations' latest immigration crackdown in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic
